newsitem.title: UK: No big change in BT /MCI deal seen-FT.
newsitem.headline: No big change in BT /MCI deal seen-FT.

text.p: The terms of a merger of British Telecommunications Plc and MCI Communications are not expected to be changed except for some changes in the MCI strategy aimed at appeasing BT shareholders worried about the $28.7 million deal, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.

Citing New York securities lawyers, the FT said the merger, thrown into doubt in July when MCI revealed that it would lose $800 million in 1997 because of difficult domestic market conditions, would be approved this week by the U.S. Federal Communications Commission.

The newspaper said the wording of a Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) filing last week of MCI's regular 10-Q quarterly financial report provided evidence that "no substantive changes in the terms have been discussed".
It quoted a U.S. securities lawyer as saying that MCI would have been obligated to indicate in the report a change in the acquisition price of the BT linkup.
According to the FT, the MCI filing said the merger should be completed by the fall 1997. BT was not immediately available for comment on Tuesday.
